info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 4:51PM CDT until July 10 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Illinois, including the following county, Winnebago.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 448 PM CDT, Doppler radar and rainfall gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen, with localized amounts over 2 inches in 90 minutes or less. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rockford, Loves Park, Machesney Park, Roscoe, South Beloit, Rockton, Pecatonica, Lake Summerset, Durand, Harrison and Shirland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING
